bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

sum_abundant_numbers() {
    limit="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=1; i<=limit; i++)); do
        divisor_sum=0
        for ((j=1; j<i; j++)); do
            if [ $((i % j)) -eq 0 ]; then
                divisor_sum=$((divisor_sum + j))
            fi
        done
        if [ "$divisor_sum" -gt "$i" ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_abundant_numbers 100
nl_command: Create a script to find the sum of all abundant numbers up to a given limit.

#!/bin/bash

certificates="/etc/ssl/certs/*.crt"

for cert in $certificates; do
    expiration_date=$(openssl x509 -enddate -noout -in $cert | cut -d '=' -f 2)
    if [ $(date -d "$expiration_date" +%s) -lt $(date -d "now + 30 days" +%s) ]; then
        echo "SSL certificate $cert is about to expire on $expiration_date" | mail -s "SSL Certificate Expiry Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system SSL certificate expiration dates and send an alert if any certificates are about to expire.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold="500"

processes=$(ps aux --sort=-%mem | awk 'NR<=5{print $11}')

while read -r process; do
    mem_usage=$(ps -C "$process" --no-headers -o %mem | awk '{print $1}')
    if [ "$mem_usage" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Process $process is consuming high memory: $mem_usage KB (root user)" | mail -s "Root High Memory Process Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$processes"
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system root user process memory usage and send an alert if any process exceeds a certain memory usage.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

while true; do
    find /etc/ssl/certs -type f -exec openssl x509 -enddate -noout -in {} + | grep -v 'notAfter' | awk '{print $1, $2, $4}' | while read -r line; do
        end_date=$(date -d"$(echo $line | awk '{print $2, $3, $4}')" +'%s')
        current_date=$(date +'%s')
        days_left=$(( (end_date - current_date) / 86400 ))
        if (( $days_left <= 30 )); then
            echo "$line Expires in $days_left days"
        fi
    done
    sleep 86400

done
nl_command: Create a script that monitors system SSL certificate expiration dates and alerts if any certificates are expiring soon.

touch /tmp/privilege_escalation_report.txt

    ausearch -k privilege_escalation >> /tmp/privilege_escalation_report.txt

done

#!/bin/bash

fragmentation_level=$(mysql -e "SELECT ROUND((DATA_LENGTH + INDEX_LENGTH) / 1024 / 1024) AS 'Size (MB)', TABLE_NAME AS 'Table Name', ROUND(DATA_FREE / 1024 / 1024) AS 'Data Free (MB)', ROUND((DATA_FREE / (DATA_LENGTH + INDEX_LENGTH)) * 100, 2) AS 'Fragmentation (%)' FROM information_schema.TABLES WHERE TABLE_SCHEMA NOT IN ('information_schema', 'performance_schema', 'mysql') ORDER BY 'Fragmentation (%)' DESC" | grep -v 'Table Name' | awk '{print $4}' | head -n 1)
threshold="20"
if [ "$fragmentation_level" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
    mysqlcheck -o --all-databases
fi

#!/bin/bash

threshold="100"

processes=$(ps aux --sort=-%io | awk 'NR<=5{print $11}')

while read -r process; do
    io_usage=$(iftop -t -s 1 | grep "$process" | awk '{print $6}')
    if [ "$io_usage" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Process $process is performing high network I/O: $io_usage KB/s (root user)" | mail -s "Root High Network I/O Process Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$processes"
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system root user process network I/O and send an alert if any process exceeds a certain network I/O threshold.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

sum_amicable_numbers() {
    limit="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=2; i<=limit; i++)); do
        divisor_sum1=0
        for ((j=1; j<i; j++)); do
            if [ $((i % j)) -eq 0 ]; then
                divisor_sum1=$((divisor_sum1 + j))
            fi
        done
        divisor_sum2=0
        for ((j=1; j<divisor_sum1; j++)); do
            if [ $((divisor_sum1 % j)) -eq 0 ]; then
                divisor_sum2=$((divisor_sum2 + j))
            fi
        done
        if [ $divisor_sum2 -eq $i ] && [ $i -ne $divisor_sum1 ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_amicable_numbers 1000
nl_command: Create a script to find the sum of all amicable numbers up to a given limit.

#!/bin/bash

threshold="10"

processes="$(ps -eo pid,ni,args --sort=ni | grep -vE 'PID|top|ps' | tail -n 5)"

while read -r line; do
    priority=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $2}')
    if [ "$priority" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Process with high priority detected for root user: $line" | mail -s "Root Process Priority Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$processes"

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

sum_prime_numbers() {
    limit="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=2; i<=limit; i++)); do
        is_prime=true
        for ((j=2; j*j<=i; j++)); do
            if [ $((i % j)) -eq 0 ]; then
                is_prime=false
                break
            fi
        done
        if [ "$is_prime" = true ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_prime_numbers 100
nl_command: Create a script to find the sum of all prime numbers up to a given limit.

#!/bin/bash

threshold="3"
tail -f /var/log/auth.log | while read line; do
    if [[ "$line" == *"Failed password"* ]]; then
        ip_address=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $11}')
        count=$(grep -c "$ip_address" /var/log/auth.log)
        if [ "$count" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
            iptables -A INPUT -s $ip_address -j DROP
        fi
    fi
done
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system SSH login attempts and block IP addresses after a certain number of failed attempts.

#!/bin/bash

fibonacci() {
    n="$1"
    a=0
    b=1
    for ((i=2; i<=n; i++)); do
        next=$((a + b))
        a="$b"
        b="$next"
    done
    echo "$b"
}
fibonacci 10

threshold=10

while true; do
    sar -n EDEV 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n SOCK 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'

done

#!/bin/bash

threshold="10"

processes="$(ps -eo pid,ni,args --sort=ni | grep -vE 'PID|top|ps' | tail -n 5)"

while read -r line; do
    priority=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $2}')
    if [ "$priority" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Process with high priority detected: $line" | mail -s "Process Priority Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$processes"

#!/bin/bash

threshold="100"

processes=$(ps aux --sort=-%io | awk 'NR<=5{print $11}')

while read -r process; do
    io_usage=$(iotop -b -n 1 | grep "$process" | awk '{print $4}')
    if [ "$io_usage" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Process $process is performing high file system I/O: $io_usage KB/s (root user)" | mail -s "Root High File System I/O Process Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$processes"
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system root user process file system I/O and send an alert if any process exceeds a certain file system I/O threshold.

#!/bin/bash

log_dir="/var/log"
max_size="1G"

for file in $log_dir/*; do
    if [ -f "$file" ] && [ $(du -b "$file" | awk '{print $1}') -gt $(numfmt --from=iec "$max_size") ]; then
        mv "$file" "$file.old"
        touch "$file"
    fi

done
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system log file sizes and rotate logs if they exceed a certain size.

while true; do

done

#!/bin/bash

threshold="80"

sensors=$(sensors | grep -E 'Core|temp[0-9]' | awk '{print $2,$3}' | tr -d '+°C' | sed 's/°F/ F/g')

while read -r line; do
    value=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $2}')
    if [ "$value" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Hardware sensor value exceeds threshold for root user: $line" | mail -s "Root Hardware Sensor Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$sensors"

#!/bin/bash

threshold="50"

processes="$(ps -eo pid,%cpu,command | grep -vE 'PID|%CPU' | sort -nr -k2 | head -n 5)"

while read -r line; do
    pid=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $1}')
    cpu=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $2}')

    if [ "$cpu" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Process $pid is consuming high CPU: $cpu%" | mail -s "High CPU Process Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$processes"

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

sum_perfect_numbers() {
    limit="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=2; i<=limit; i++)); do
        divisor_sum=0
        for ((j=1; j<i; j++)); do
            if [ $((i % j)) -eq 0 ]; then
                divisor_sum=$((divisor_sum + j))
            fi
        done
        if [ "$divisor_sum" -eq "$i" ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_perfect_numbers 1000
nl_command: Create a script to find the sum of all perfect numbers up to a given limit.

#!/bin/bash

certificates="/etc/ssl/certs/*.crt"

for cert in $certificates; do
    expiration_date=$(openssl x509 -enddate -noout -in $cert | cut -d '=' -f 2)
    if [ $(date -d "$expiration_date" +%s) -lt $(date -d "now + 30 days" +%s) ]; then
        echo "SSL certificate $cert is about to expire on $expiration_date" | mail -s "SSL Certificate Expiry Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

sum_prime_numbers() {
    limit="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=2; i<limit; i++)); do
        is_prime=true
        for ((j=2; j*j<=i; j++)); do
            if [ $((i % j)) -eq 0 ]; then
                is_prime=false
                break
            fi
        done
        if [ "$is_prime" = true ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_prime_numbers 2000000
nl_command: Create a script to find the sum of all prime numbers below a given limit.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

largest_and_smallest() {
    arr=(10 20 5 40 30)
    largest="${arr[0]}"
    smallest="${arr[0]}"
    for num in "${arr[@]}"; do
        if [ "$num" -gt "$largest" ]; then
            largest="$num"
        fi
        if [ "$num" -lt "$smallest" ]; then
            smallest="$num"
        fi
    done
    echo "Largest number: $largest"
    echo "Smallest number: $smallest"
}
largest_and_smallest
nl_command: Create a script to find the largest and smallest numbers in an array.

#!/bin/bash

is_palindrome() {
    string="$1"
    reversed=$(echo "$string" | rev)
    if [ "$string" = "$reversed" ]; then
        echo "$string is a palindrome"
    else
        echo "$string is not a palindrome"

}

limit=50
a=0
b=1
echo "Fibonacci Series up to $limit:" 
while [ "$a" -le "$limit" ]; do

    a="$b"
    b="$fn"
done

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold=10

while true; do
    sar -n EDEV 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n SOCK 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n COLL 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    netstat -s | grep 'retransmited' | awk '$1 > "$threshold" {print $1}'
    netstat -s | awk '/established/ && $1 > "$threshold" {print $1}'
    iostat -x | awk '$1 ~ /^[a-zA-Z]/ && $14 > "$threshold" {print $1, $14}'
    memory_usage=$(free | grep Mem | awk '{print $3/$2 * 100.0}')
    if (( $(echo "$memory_usage > $threshold" | bc -l) )); then
        echo "High memory usage: $memory_usage%"
    fi
    sleep 60

done
nl_command: Create a script that monitors system network interface errors, drops, FIFO errors, collisions, TCP retransmission rate, TCP connection state, disk I/O activity, and memory usage and alerts if any interface exceeds a certain threshold.

#!/bin/bash

count_occurrences() {
    arr=(1 2 2 3 3 4 5 5)
    declare -A occurrences
    for num in "${arr[@]}"; do
        occurrences[$num]=$((occurrences[$num] + 1))
    done
    for key in "${!occurrences[@]}"; do
        echo "$key: ${occurrences[$key]}"
    done
}
count_occurrences

#!/bin/bash

website="www.example.com"
expiry_date=$(echo | openssl s_client -servername "$website" -connect "$website":443 2>/dev/null | openssl x509 -noout -dates | grep "notAfter" | cut -d= -f2)
current_date=$(date --date="$(date)" +"%s")
expiry_date=$(date --date="$expiry_date" +"%s")
diff=$((expiry_date-current_date))
days=$((diff/(60*60*24)))
echo "$website SSL certificate expires in $days days."
nl_command: Create a script to check SSL certificate expiry date for a website.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

longest_substring() {
    str="$1"
    max_length=0
    longest_substr=""
    for ((i=0; i<${#str}; i++)); do
        for ((j=i+1; j<=${#str}; j++)); do
            substring="${str:i:j-i}"
            if [[ "$substring" =~ ^(.).*\1 ]]; then
                break
            fi
            length=${#substring}
            if [ "$length" -gt "$max_length" ]; then
                max_length="$length"
                longest_substr="$substring"
            fi
        done
    done
    echo "$longest_substr"
}
longest_substring "abcabcbb"
nl_command: Create a script to find the longest substring without repeating characters in a given string.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

is_armstrong_number() {
    num="$1"
    sum=0
    original_num="$num"
    while [ "$num" -gt 0 ]; do
        digit=$((num % 10))
        sum=$((sum + digit * digit * digit))
        num=$((num / 10))
    done
    if [ "$sum" -eq "$original_num" ]; then
        echo "$original_num is an Armstrong number"
    else
        echo "$original_num is not an Armstrong number"
    fi
}
is_armstrong_number 153
nl_command: Create a script to check if a given number is an Armstrong number or not.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold="10"

total_cpu=$(nproc)

processes=$(ps aux --sort=-%cpu | awk 'NR<=5{print $11}')

while read -r process; do
    cpu_usage=$(ps -C "$process" --no-headers -o %cpu | awk '{print $1}')
    cpu_usage_percentage=$(echo "scale=2; ($cpu_usage * 100) / $total_cpu" | bc)
    if [ "$cpu_usage_percentage" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Process $process is consuming high CPU percentage: $cpu_usage_percentage% of total available CPU (root user)" | mail -s "Root High CPU Percentage Process Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$processes"
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system root user process CPU usage and send an alert if any process exceeds a certain CPU usage percentage of total available CPU.

#!/bin/bash

count_divisors() {
    num="$1"
    count=0
    for ((i=1; i<=num; i++)); do
        if [ $((num % i)) -eq 0 ]; then
            count=$((count + 1))
        fi
    done
    echo "$count"
}

#!/bin/bash

sum_of_digits() {
    num="$1"
    while [ ${#num} -gt 1 ]; do
        sum=0
        for ((i=0; i<${#num}; i++)); do
            digit=${num:i:1}
            sum=$((sum + digit))
        done
        num="$sum"
    done
    echo "$num"

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

sum_abundant_numbers() {
    limit="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=1; i<=limit; i++)); do
        divisor_sum=0
        for ((j=1; j<i; j++)); do
            if [ $((i % j)) -eq 0 ]; then
                divisor_sum=$((divisor_sum + j))
            fi
        done
        if [ "$divisor_sum" -gt "$i" ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_abundant_numbers 100
nl_command: Create a script to find the sum of all abundant numbers up to a given limit.

#!/bin/bash

file_systems="$(df -h | grep -vE '^Filesystem|tmpfs|cdrom' | awk '{print $5,$6}' | sed 's/%//g')"

while read -r line; do
    usage=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $1}')
    mount_point=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $2}')
    if [ "$usage" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "File system usage exceeds threshold for root user: $usage% on $mount_point" | mail -s "Root File System Usage Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$file_systems"

#!/bin/bash

certificates="/etc/ssl/certs/*.crt"

for cert in $certificates; do
    expiration_date=$(openssl x509 -enddate -noout -in $cert | cut -d '=' -f 2)
    if [ $(date -d "$expiration_date" +%s) -lt $(date -d "now + 30 days" +%s) ]; then
        echo "SSL certificate $cert is about to expire on $expiration_date" | mail -s "SSL Certificate Expiry Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done

#!/bin/bash

threshold="50"

current_hour=$(date +'%H')

if [ "$current_hour" -ge "8" ] && [ "$current_hour" -le "18" ]; then
    processes=$(ps aux --sort=-%cpu | awk 'NR<=5{print $11}')

    while read -r process; do
        cpu_usage=$(ps -C "$process" --no-headers -o %cpu | awk '{print $1}')
        if (( $(echo "$cpu_usage > $threshold" | bc -l) )); then
            echo "Process $process is consuming high CPU during business hours: $cpu_usage% (root user)" | mail -s "Root High CPU Process during Business Hours Alert" user@example.com
        fi
    done <<< "$processes"
fi
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system root user process CPU usage and send an alert if any process exceeds a certain CPU usage during specific hours.

#!/bin/bash

sum_multiples() {
    limit="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=1; i<limit; i++)); do
        if [ $((i % 3)) -eq 0 ] || [ $((i % 5)) -eq 0 ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_multiples 1000

#!/bin/bash

threshold="90"

disks="$(df -h | awk '{print $1,$5}' | grep '%' | sed 's/%//')"

while read -r line; do
    disk=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $1}')
    usage=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $2}')

    if [ "$usage" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Disk $disk is running out of space: $usage%" | mail -s "Disk Space Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$disks"

#!/bin/bash

process_name="process_name"
threshold=50

if pgrep -x $process_name >/dev/null; then
    cpu_usage=$(ps -p $(pgrep -x $process_name) -o %cpu | tail -n +2)
    if (( $(echo "$cpu_usage > $threshold" | bc -l) )); then
        kill $(pgrep -x $process_name)
        echo "$process_name terminated due to high CPU usage"
    fi
fi

#!/bin/bash

lower=10
upper=50
echo "Prime numbers between $lower and $upper:" 
for ((num=lower; num<=upper; num++)); do
    is_prime=true
    for ((i=2; i<=num/2; i++)); do
        if [ $((num % i)) -eq 0 ]; then
            is_prime=false
            break
        fi
    done
    if [ "$is_prime" = true ]; then
        echo "$num"
    fi
done

#!/bin/bash

is_palindrome() {
    str="$1"
    reversed=""
    for ((i=${#str}-1; i>=0; i--)); do
        reversed+=${str:i:1}
    done
    if [ "$str" = "$reversed" ]; then
        echo "$str is a palindrome"
    else
        echo "$str is not a palindrome"
    fi
}
is_palindrome "level"

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold=90

while true; do
    memory_usage=$(free | grep Mem | awk '{print $3/$2 * 100.0}')
    if (( $(echo "$memory_usage > $threshold" | bc -l) )); then
        echo "High memory usage: $memory_usage%"
    fi
    sleep 60

    swap_usage=$(free | grep Swap | awk '{print $3/$2 * 100.0}')
    if (( $(echo "$swap_usage > $threshold" | bc -l) )); then
        echo "High swap usage: $swap_usage%"
    fi
    sleep 60
done

#!/bin/bash

sum_prime_numbers() {
    limit="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=2; i<limit; i++)); do
        is_prime=true
        for ((j=2; j*j<=i; j++)); do
            if [ $((i % j)) -eq 0 ]; then
                is_prime=false
                break
            fi
        done
        if [ "$is_prime" = true ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    echo "$sum"
}

#!/bin/bash

certificates="/etc/ssl/certs/*.crt"

for cert in $certificates; do
    expiration_date=$(openssl x509 -enddate -noout -in $cert | cut -d '=' -f 2)
    if [ $(date -d "$expiration_date" +%s) -lt $(date -d "now + 30 days" +%s) ]; then
        echo "SSL certificate $cert is about to expire on $expiration_date" | mail -s "SSL Certificate Expiry Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done

#!/bin/bash

sum_of_squares() {
    num="$1"
    sum=0
    while [ "$num" -gt 0 ]; do
        digit=$((num % 10))
        sum=$((sum + digit * digit))
        num=$((num / 10))
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_of_squares 123

#!/bin/bash

min_of_three() {
    a="$1"
    b="$2"
    c="$3"
    if [ "$a" -le "$b" ] && [ "$a" -le "$c" ]; then
        echo "$a is the smallest"
    elif [ "$b" -le "$a" ] && [ "$b" -le "$c" ]; then
        echo "$b is the smallest"
    else
        echo "$c is the smallest"
    fi
}

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold="10"

total_mem=$(free -m | awk 'NR==2{print $2}')

processes=$(ps aux --sort=-%mem | awk 'NR<=5{print $11}')

while read -r process; do
    mem_usage=$(ps -C "$process" --no-headers -o %mem | awk '{print $1}')
    mem_usage_percentage=$(echo "scale=2; ($mem_usage * $total_mem) / 100" | bc)
    if [ "$mem_usage_percentage" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Process $process is consuming high memory percentage: $mem_usage_percentage% of total available memory (root user)" | mail -s "Root High Memory Percentage Process Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$processes"
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system root user process memory usage and send an alert if any process exceeds a certain memory usage percentage of total available memory.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

sum_prime_factors() {
    num="$1"
    sum=0
    factor=2
    while [ "$num" -gt 1 ]; do
        if [ $((num % factor)) -eq 0 ]; then
            sum=$((sum + factor))
            while [ $((num % factor)) -eq 0 ]; do
                num=$((num / factor))
            done
        fi
        factor=$((factor + 1))
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_prime_factors 36
nl_command: Create a script to find the sum of all prime factors of a given number.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

largest_palindrome() {
    largest=0
    for ((i=100; i<1000; i++)); do
        for ((j=100; j<1000; j++)); do
            product=$((i * j))
            if [ $product -eq $(echo $product | rev) ] && [ $product -gt $largest ]; then
                largest=$product
            fi
        done
    done
    echo "$largest"
}
largest_palindrome
nl_command: Create a script to find the largest palindrome made from the product of two 3-digit numbers.

#!/bin/bash

threshold="1"

current_hour=$(date +'%H')

if [ "$current_hour" -ge "8" ] && [ "$current_hour" -le "18" ]; then
    non_default_priorities="$(ps -eo pid,comm,nice --sort nice | awk '$3 != 0' | tail -n 5)"

    if [ -n "$non_default_priorities" ]; then
        echo "Processes with non-default CPU scheduling priority for root user during business hours: $non_default_priorities" | mail -s "Root Non-default CPU Priority during Business Hours Alert" user@example.com
    fi
fi

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

certificates="/etc/ssl/certs/*.crt"

for cert in $certificates; do
    expiration_date=$(openssl x509 -enddate -noout -in $cert | cut -d '=' -f 2)
    if [ $(date -d "$expiration_date" +%s) -lt $(date -d "now + 30 days" +%s) ]; then
        echo "SSL certificate $cert is about to expire on $expiration_date" | mail -s "SSL Certificate Expiry Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system SSL certificate expiration dates and send an alert if any certificates are about to expire.

failed_pipelines=$(curl -s "http://gitlab.example.com/api/v4/projects/<project_id>/pipelines" | jq -r '.[] | select(.status == "failed") | .id')

fi

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

is_palindrome() {
    num="$1"
    reversed=""
    temp="$num"
    while [ "$temp" -gt 0 ]; do
        remainder=$((temp % 10))
        reversed="$(echo "$reversed$remainder")"
        temp=$((temp / 10))
    done
    if [ "$num" -eq "$reversed" ]; then
        echo "$num is a palindrome"
    else
        echo "$num is not a palindrome"
    fi
}
is_palindrome 12321
nl_command: Create a script to check if a given number is a palindrome or not.

threshold="5"

time_drift=$(ntpdate -q time.nist.gov | grep -o 'offset.*' | awk '{print $2}')

if [ "$time_drift_abs" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
    echo "System time drift is high for root user: $time_drift seconds" | mail -s "Root Time Drift Alert" user@example.com
fi

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

arr=(5 10 3 8 20)
max=${arr[0]}
second_max=0
for num in "${arr[@]}"; do
    if [ "$num" -gt "$max" ]; then
        second_max="$max"
        max="$num"
    elif [ "$num" -gt "$second_max" ] && [ "$num" -ne "$max" ]; then
        second_max="$num"
    fi
done
echo "The second largest number in the array is: $second_max"

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold=10

while true; do
    sar -n EDEV 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n SOCK 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n COLL 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    netstat -s | grep 'retransmited' | awk '$1 > "$threshold" {print $1}'
    netstat -s | awk '/established/ && $1 > "$threshold" {print $1}'
    iostat -x | awk '$1 ~ /^[a-zA-Z]/ && $14 > "$threshold" {print $1, $14}'
    sleep 60

done
nl_command: Create a script that monitors system network interface errors, drops, FIFO errors, collisions, TCP retransmission rate, TCP connection state, and disk I/O activity and alerts if any interface exceeds a certain threshold.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

website="www.example.com"
expiry_date=$(echo | openssl s_client -servername "$website" -connect "$website":443 2>/dev/null | openssl x509 -noout -dates | grep "notAfter" | cut -d= -f2)
current_date=$(date --date="$(date)" +"%s")
expiry_date=$(date --date="$expiry_date" +"%s")
diff=$((expiry_date-current_date))
days=$((diff/(60*60*24)))
echo "$website SSL certificate expires in $days days."
nl_command: Create a script to check SSL certificate expiry date for a website.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

fibonacci_sequence() {
    terms="$1"
    a=0
    b=1
    echo -n "Fibonacci sequence: $a $b"
    for ((i=2; i<terms; i++)); do
        next=$((a + b))
        echo -n " $next"
        a="$b"
        b="$next"
    done
    echo
}
fibonacci_sequence 10
nl_command: Create a script to find the Fibonacci sequence up to a specified number of terms.

#!/bin/bash

while true; do
    iptables-save > /tmp/iptables_backup
    sleep 3600
    if ! cmp -s /tmp/iptables_backup /etc/iptables/rules.v4; then
        echo "Firewall rules have been modified"

    rm -f /tmp/iptables_backup
    sleep 3600

done

failed_pipelines=$(curl -s "http://gitlab.example.com/api/v4/projects/<project_id>/pipelines" | jq -r '.[] | select(.status == "failed") | .id')
if [ -n "$stuck_pipelines" ] || [ -n "$failed_pipelines" ]; then

#!/bin/bash

website="www.example.com"
expiry_date=$(echo | openssl s_client -servername "$website" -connect "$website":443 2>/dev/null | openssl x509 -noout -dates | grep "notAfter" | cut -d= -f2)
current_date=$(date --date="$(date)" +"%s")
expiry_date=$(date --date="$expiry_date" +"%s")
diff=$((expiry_date-current_date))
days=$((diff/(60*60*24)))
echo "$website SSL certificate expires in $days days."
nl_command: Create a script to check SSL certificate expiry date for a website.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

fibonacci_sequence() {
    terms="$1"
    a=0
    b=1
    echo -n "Fibonacci sequence: $a $b"
    for ((i=2; i<terms; i++)); do
        next=$((a + b))
        echo -n " $next"
        a="$b"
        b="$next"
    done
    echo
}
fibonacci_sequence 10
nl_command: Create a script to find the Fibonacci sequence up to a specified number of terms.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

largest_prime_factor() {
    num="$1"
    factor=2
    while [ "$factor" -le "$num" ]; do
        if [ $((num % factor)) -eq 0 ]; then
            num=$((num / factor))
        else
            factor=$((factor + 1))
        fi
    done
    echo "$factor"
}
largest_prime_factor 600851475143
nl_command: Create a script to find the largest prime factor of a given number.

threshold="90"

fi

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

largest_palindrome() {
    largest=0
    for ((i=100; i<1000; i++)); do
        for ((j=100; j<1000; j++)); do
            product=$((i * j))
            if [ $product -eq $(echo $product | rev) ] && [ $product -gt $largest ]; then
                largest=$product
            fi
        done
    done
    echo "$largest"
}
largest_palindrome
nl_command: Create a script to find the largest palindrome made from the product of two 3-digit numbers.

#!/bin/bash

password_age_threshold="30"

users="$(awk -F: '{ print $1 }' /etc/passwd)"

for user in $users; do
    password_age="$(chage -l $user | grep '^Password expires' | awk -F: '{print $2}')"
    if [ "$(echo "$password_age <= $password_age_threshold" | bc)" -eq 1 ]; then
        echo "User $user password is due for expiration." | mail -s "Password Expiration Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

sum_even_fibonacci() {
    limit="$1"
    a=0
    b=1
    sum=0
    while [ "$b" -lt "$limit" ]; do
        if [ $((b % 2)) -eq 0 ]; then
            sum=$((sum + b))
        fi
        next=$((a + b))
        a="$b"
        b="$next"
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_even_fibonacci 4000000
nl_command: Create a script to find the sum of all even Fibonacci numbers less than a given limit.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold="50"

processes=$(ps aux --sort=-%cpu | awk 'NR<=5{print $11}')

while read -r process; do
    cpu_usage=$(ps -C "$process" --no-headers -o %cpu | awk '{print $1}')
    if (( $(echo "$cpu_usage > $threshold" | bc -l) )); then
        echo "Process $process is consuming high CPU: $cpu_usage% (root user)" | mail -s "Root High CPU Process Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$processes"
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system root user process CPU usage and send an alert if any process exceeds a certain CPU usage.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold=2.0

for ((i=0; i<6; i++)); do
    load_average=$(uptime | awk '{print $10}')
    if (( $(echo "$load_average > $threshold" | bc -l) )); then
        echo "System load average is high: $load_average"
    fi
    sleep 10
done

#!/bin/bash

threshold="100"

multicast_packets=$(tcpdump -c 100 multicast | grep 'packets captured' | awk '{print $1}')

if [ "$multicast_packets" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
    echo "System multicast packets count is too high: $multicast_packets" | mail -s "High Multicast Packets Alert" user@example.com
fi

#!/bin/bash

disks="/dev/sda /dev/sdb"

for disk in $disks; do
    smartctl -q errorsonly $disk
    if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
        echo "Disk $disk is failing SMART test." | mail -s "Disk SMART Alert" user@example.com
    fi
done

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

largest_prime_factor() {
    num="$1"
    factor=2
    while [ "$factor" -le "$num" ]; do
        if [ $((num % factor)) -eq 0 ]; then
            num=$((num / factor))
        else
            factor=$((factor + 1))
        fi
    done
    echo "$factor"
}
largest_prime_factor 600851475143
nl_command: Create a script to find the largest prime factor of a given number.

#!/bin/bash

product_of_digits() {
    num="$1"
    product=1
    while [ "$num" -gt 0 ]; do
        digit=$((num % 10))
        product=$((product * digit))
        num=$((num / 10))
    done
    echo "$product"
}
product_of_digits 12345
nl_command: Create a script to find the product of digits of a number.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold="100"

current_hour=$(date +'%H')

if [ "$current_hour" -ge "8" ] && [ "$current_hour" -le "18" ]; then
    processes=$(ps aux --sort=-%io | awk 'NR<=5{print $11}')

    while read -r process; do
        io_usage=$(iotop -b -n 1 | grep "$process" | awk '{print $10}')
        if [ "$io_usage" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
            echo "Process $process is performing high disk I/O during business hours: $io_usage KB/s (root user)" | mail -s "Root High Disk I/O Process during Business Hours Alert" user@example.com
        fi
    done <<< "$processes"
fi
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system root user process disk I/O and send an alert if any process exceeds a certain disk I/O threshold during specific hours.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

sum_abundant_numbers() {
    limit="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=1; i<=limit; i++)); do
        divisor_sum=0
        for ((j=1; j<i; j++)); do
            if [ $((i % j)) -eq 0 ]; then
                divisor_sum=$((divisor_sum + j))
            fi
        done
        if [ "$divisor_sum" -gt "$i" ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_abundant_numbers 100
nl_command: Create a script to find the sum of all abundant numbers up to a given limit.

min_cpu=$(echo "$node_cpu" | sort -n | head -n 1)

fi

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

sum_even_fibonacci() {
    limit="$1"
    a=0
    b=1
    sum=0
    while [ "$b" -lt "$limit" ]; do
        if [ $((b % 2)) -eq 0 ]; then
            sum=$((sum + b))
        fi
        next=$((a + b))
        a="$b"
        b="$next"
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_even_fibonacci 4000000
nl_command: Create a script to find the sum of all even Fibonacci numbers less than a given limit.

#!/bin/bash

while true; do
    cat /etc/sudoers > /tmp/sudoers_backup
    sleep 3600
    if ! cmp -s /tmp/sudoers_backup /etc/sudoers; then
        echo "Sudoers configuration has been modified"
    fi
    rm -f /tmp/sudoers_backup
    sleep 3600

done

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold=10

while true; do
    sar -n EDEV 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n SOCK 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n COLL 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    netstat -s | grep 'retransmited' | awk '$1 > "$threshold" {print $1}'
    netstat -s | awk '/established/ && $1 > "$threshold" {print $1}'
    sleep 60

done

#!/bin/bash

startup_time_threshold=10
slow_startup_services=$(systemd-analyze blame | grep 's' | awk '{print $2}')
for service in "$slow_startup_services"; do
    service_startup_time=$(systemd-analyze blame | grep "$service" | awk '{print $1}')
    if [ "$service_startup_time" -gt "$startup_time_threshold" ]; then
        echo "Service $service takes too long to start."
        # Send alert here
    fi
done

#!/bin/bash

certificates="/etc/ssl/certs/*.crt"

for cert in $certificates; do
    expiration_date=$(openssl x509 -enddate -noout -in $cert | cut -d '=' -f 2)
    if [ $(date -d "$expiration_date" +%s) -lt $(date -d "now + 30 days" +%s) ]; then
        echo "SSL certificate $cert is about to expire on $expiration_date" | mail -s "SSL Certificate Expiry Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

is_perfect_number() {
    num="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=1; i<num; i++)); do
        if [ $((num % i)) -eq 0 ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    if [ "$sum" -eq "$num" ]; then
        echo "$num is a perfect number"
    else
        echo "$num is not a perfect number"
    fi
}
is_perfect_number 28
nl_command: Create a script to check if a given number is a perfect number or not.

#!/bin/bash

words=("apple" "banana" "orange" "strawberry" "grape")
longest_word=""
for word in "${words[@]}"; do

        longest_word="$word"

done
echo "The longest word in the list is: $longest_word"

#!/bin/bash

threshold=10

while true; do
    sar -n EDEV 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n SOCK 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n COLL 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    netstat -s | grep 'retransmited' | awk '$1 > "$threshold" {print $1}'
    sleep 60

done

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold=10

while true; do
    sar -n EDEV 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n SOCK 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n COLL 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    netstat -s | grep 'retransmited' | awk '$1 > "$threshold" {print $1}'
    netstat -s | awk '/established/ && $1 > "$threshold" {print $1}'
    sleep 60

done

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold_cpu="90"
threshold_mem="90"

while true; do
    pid_cpu=$(ps -eo pid,%cpu --sort=-%cpu | awk 'NR==2 {print $1}')
    pid_mem=$(ps -eo pid,%mem --sort=-%mem | awk 'NR==2 {print $1}')
    cpu_usage=$(ps -p $pid_cpu -o %cpu | tail -1)
    mem_usage=$(ps -p $pid_mem -o %mem | tail -1)

    if [ $(echo "$cpu_usage > $threshold_cpu" | bc) -eq 1 ]; then
        kill -9 $pid_cpu
    fi

    if [ $(echo "$mem_usage > $threshold_mem" | bc) -eq 1 ]; then
        kill -9 $pid_mem
    fi

    sleep 60
done
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system process usage and terminate processes consuming excessive CPU or memory.

#!/bin/bash

threshold="50"

processes=$(ps aux --sort=-%cpu | awk 'NR<=5{print $11}')

while read -r process; do
    cpu_usage=$(ps -C "$process" --no-headers -o %cpu | awk '{print $1}')
    if (( $(echo "$cpu_usage > $threshold" | bc -l) )); then
        echo "Process $process is consuming high CPU: $cpu_usage%" | mail -s "High CPU Process Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$processes"

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

is_armstrong_number() {
    num="$1"
    sum=0
    original_num="$num"
    while [ "$num" -gt 0 ]; do
        digit=$((num % 10))
        sum=$((sum + digit * digit * digit))
        num=$((num / 10))
    done
    if [ "$sum" -eq "$original_num" ]; then
        echo "$original_num is an Armstrong number"
    else
        echo "$original_num is not an Armstrong number"
    fi
}
is_armstrong_number 153
nl_command: Create a script to check if a given number is an Armstrong number or not.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold="500000"

processes="$(ps -eo pid,%mem,cmd | grep -vE 'PID|%MEM' | sort -nr -k2 | head -n 5)"

while read -r line; do
    pid=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $1}')
    mem=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $2}')

    if [ "$mem" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Process $pid is consuming high memory: $mem KB" | mail -s "High Memory Process Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$processes"
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system memory usage by process and send an alert if any process consumes excessive memory.

#!/bin/bash

threshold=70

for ((i=0; i<6; i++)); do
    cpu_temp=$(sensors | grep 'Tdie' | awk '{print $2}')
    if (( $(echo "$cpu_temp > $threshold" | bc -l) )); then
        echo "High CPU temperature: $cpu_temp°C"
    fi
    sleep 10
done

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

largest_palindrome() {
    digits="$1"
    max=$(printf '1%.0s' $(seq 1 $digits))
    min=$((max / 10))
    largest=0
    for ((i=max; i>=min; i--)); do
        for ((j=max; j>=min; j--)); do
            product=$((i * j))
            if [ $product -lt $largest ]; then
                break
            fi
            reverse=$(echo $product | rev)
            if [ $product -eq $reverse ] && [ $product -gt $largest ]; then
                largest=$product
            fi
        done
    done
    echo "$largest"
}
largest_palindrome 2
nl_command: Create a script to find the largest palindrome made from the product of two n-digit numbers.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold=10

while true; do
    sar -n EDEV 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n SOCK 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n COLL 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    netstat -s | grep 'retransmited' | awk '$1 > "$threshold" {print $1}'
    netstat -s | awk '/established/ && $1 > "$threshold" {print $1}'
    iostat -x | awk '$1 ~ /^[a-zA-Z]/ && $14 > "$threshold" {print $1, $14}'
    sleep 60

done
nl_command: Create a script that monitors system network interface errors, drops, FIFO errors, collisions, TCP retransmission rate, TCP connection state, and disk I/O activity and alerts if any interface exceeds a certain threshold.

#!/bin/bash

str="radar"
reversed=""
for ((i=${#str}-1; i>=0; i--)); do
    reversed+="${str:i:1}"
done
if [ "$str" = "$reversed" ]; then
    echo "$str is a palindrome"
else
    echo "$str is not a palindrome"
fi

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

dns_server="8.8.8.8"
domain="example.com"
dig +short @${dns_server} ${domain} | sort > /tmp/current_dns_records.txt
echo "" > /tmp/previous_dns_records.txt
while true; do
    dig +short @${dns_server} ${domain} | sort > /tmp/current_dns_records.txt
    if ! cmp -s /tmp/current_dns_records.txt /tmp/previous_dns_records.txt; then
        diff /tmp/previous_dns_records.txt /tmp/current_dns_records.txt | mail -s "DNS Records Change Alert" user@example.com
    fi
    sleep 3600
    mv /tmp/current_dns_records.txt /tmp/previous_dns_records.txt
done
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system DNS records and send alerts when changes are detected (e.g., new records, changes in IP addresses).

#!/bin/bash

count_occurrences() {
    arr=(1 2 2 3 3 4 5 5)
    declare -A occurrences
    for num in "${arr[@]}"; do
        occurrences[$num]=$((occurrences[$num] + 1))
    done
    for key in "${!occurrences[@]}"; do
        echo "$key: ${occurrences[$key]}"
    done
}
count_occurrences
nl_command: Create a script to count the number of occurrences of each element in an array.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

sum_multiples() {
    limit="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=1; i<limit; i++)); do
        if [ $((i % 3)) -eq 0 ] || [ $((i % 5)) -eq 0 ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_multiples 1000

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold="100"

current_hour=$(date +'%H')

if [ "$current_hour" -ge "8" ] && [ "$current_hour" -le "18" ]; then
    processes=$(ps aux --sort=-%io | awk 'NR<=5{print $11}')

    while read -r process; do
        io_usage=$(iotop -b -n 1 | grep "$process" | awk '{print $4}')
        if [ "$io_usage" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
            echo "Process $process is performing high file system I/O during business hours: $io_usage KB/s (root user)" | mail -s "Root High File System I/O Process during Business Hours Alert" user@example.com
        fi
    done <<< "$processes"
fi
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system root user process file system I/O and send an alert if any process exceeds a certain file system I/O threshold during specific hours.

#!/bin/bash

smallest_divisible() {
    n="$1"
    result=1
    for ((i=1; i<=n; i++)); do
        divisor=1
        while [ $((result % i)) -ne 0 ]; do
            result=$((result + 1))
        done
    done
    echo "$result"
}

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

largest_and_smallest() {
    arr=(10 20 5 40 30)
    largest="${arr[0]}"
    smallest="${arr[0]}"
    for num in "${arr[@]}"; do
        if [ "$num" -gt "$largest" ]; then
            largest="$num"
        fi
        if [ "$num" -lt "$smallest" ]; then
            smallest="$num"
        fi
    done
    echo "Largest number: $largest"
    echo "Smallest number: $smallest"
}
largest_and_smallest

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

smallest_divisible() {
    n="$1"
    result=1
    for ((i=1; i<=n; i++)); do
        divisor=1
        while [ $((result % i)) -ne 0 ]; do
            result=$((result + 1))
        done
    done
    echo "$result"
}
smallest_divisible 10

#!/bin/bash

largest_and_smallest() {
    arr=(10 20 5 40 30)
    largest="${arr[0]}"
    smallest="${arr[0]}"
    for num in "${arr[@]}"; do
        if [ "$num" -gt "$largest" ]; then
            largest="$num"
        fi
        if [ "$num" -lt "$smallest" ]; then
            smallest="$num"
        fi
    done
    echo "Largest number: $largest"
    echo "Smallest number: $smallest"
}
largest_and_smallest

#!/bin/bash

is_anagram() {
    string1="$1"
    string2="$2"
    if [ "$(echo "$string1" | tr -d ' ' | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]' | grep -o . | sort | tr -d '
')" = "$(echo "$string2" | tr -d ' ' | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]' | grep -o . | sort | tr -d '
')" ]; then
        echo "$string1 and $string2 are anagrams"
    else
        echo "$string1 and $string2 are not anagrams"
    fi
}

nl_command: Create a script to check if a given string is an anagram of another string.

#!/bin/bash

threshold="100"

processes=$(ps aux --sort=-%io | awk 'NR<=5{print $11}')

while read -r process; do
    io_usage=$(iotop -b -n 1 | grep "$process" | awk '{print $10}')
    if [ "$io_usage" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Process $process is performing high disk I/O: $io_usage KB/s (root user)" | mail -s "Root High Disk I/O Process Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$processes"

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

sum_prime_numbers() {
    limit="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=2; i<limit; i++)); do
        is_prime=true
        for ((j=2; j*j<=i; j++)); do
            if [ $((i % j)) -eq 0 ]; then
                is_prime=false
                break
            fi
        done
        if [ "$is_prime" = true ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_prime_numbers 2000000
nl_command: Create a script to find the sum of all prime numbers below a given limit.

#!/bin/bash

threshold="100"

current_hour=$(date +'%H')

if [ "$current_hour" -ge "8" ] && [ "$current_hour" -le "18" ]; then
    processes=$(ps aux --sort=-%io | awk 'NR<=5{print $11}')

    while read -r process; do
        io_usage=$(iftop -t -s 1 | grep "$process" | awk '{print $6}')
        if [ "$io_usage" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
            echo "Process $process is performing high network I/O during business hours: $io_usage KB/s (root user)" | mail -s "Root High Network I/O Process during Business Hours Alert" user@example.com
        fi
    done <<< "$processes"
fi

#!/bin/bash

sum_proper_divisors() {
    num="$1"
    sum=0
    for ((i=1; i<num; i++)); do
        if [ $((num % i)) -eq 0 ]; then
            sum=$((sum + i))
        fi
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_proper_divisors 28
nl_command: Create a script to find the sum of proper divisors of a number.

touch /tmp/process_activity_report.txt
while true; do
    ps -eo pid,ppid,cmd --sort=pid | awk 'NR==1{p=$1;next} $2!=p+1{print "Process with PID " p " terminated"} {p=$1}' >> /tmp/process_activity_report.txt
    ps -eo pid,ppid,cmd --sort=ppid | awk 'NR==1{p=$2;next} $2!=p+1{print "Process with PID " $1 " created"} {p=$2}' >> /tmp/process_activity_report.txt
    sleep 3600

done

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

baseline_checksum="baseline_checksum.txt"
current_checksum="current_checksum.txt"

# Create baseline checksum if it doesn't exist
if [ ! -f "$baseline_checksum" ]; then
    find / -type f -exec md5sum {} + > "$baseline_checksum"
    exit 0
fi

# Compare current checksum with baseline
md5sum -c --quiet "$baseline_checksum"
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "File system integrity compromised."
    # Send alert here
fi

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold=10

while true; do
    sar -n EDEV 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n SOCK 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n COLL 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    netstat -s | grep 'retransmited' | awk '$1 > "$threshold" {print $1}'
    netstat -s | awk '/established/ && $1 > "$threshold" {print $1}'
    iostat -x | awk '$1 ~ /^[a-zA-Z]/ && $14 > "$threshold" {print $1, $14}'
    memory_usage=$(free | grep Mem | awk '{print $3/$2 * 100.0}')
    if (( $(echo "$memory_usage > $threshold" | bc -l) )); then
        echo "High memory usage: $memory_usage%"
    fi
    sleep 60

done
nl_command: Create a script that monitors system network interface errors, drops, FIFO errors, collisions, TCP retransmission rate, TCP connection state, disk I/O activity, and memory usage and alerts if any interface exceeds a certain threshold.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

num1=12
num2=18
lcm=$((num1 * num2 / $(gcd $num1 $num2)))
echo "The LCM of $num1 and $num2 is: $lcm"

gcd() {
    num1="$1"
    num2="$2"
    while [ "$num2" -ne 0 ]; do
        remainder=$((num1 % num2))
        num1="$num2"
        num2="$remainder"
    done
    echo "$num1"
}

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

smallest_divisible() {
    n="$1"
    number="$n"
    while true; do
        divisible=true
        for ((i=1; i<=n; i++)); do
            if [ $((number % i)) -ne 0 ]; then
                divisible=false
                break
            fi
        done
        if [ "$divisible" = true ]; then
            echo "$number"
            break
        fi
        number=$((number + n))
    done
}
smallest_divisible 10
nl_command: Create a script to find the smallest number divisible by each of the numbers 1 to n.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold_cpu="80"
threshold_mem="80"

processes=$(ps aux | sort -nk +4 | tail -n 5)

while read -r line; do
    pid=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $2}')
    cpu=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $3}')
    mem=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $4}')

    if (( $(echo "$cpu > $threshold_cpu" | bc -l) )); then
        echo "Process $pid is consuming excessive CPU: $cpu%" | mail -s "High CPU Usage Alert" user@example.com
    fi

    if (( $(echo "$mem > $threshold_mem" | bc -l) )); then
        echo "Process $pid is consuming excessive memory: $mem%" | mail -s "High Memory Usage Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$processes"
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system processes and send an alert if any processes are consuming excessive CPU or memory.

    echo "SSL certificate is about to expire on $cert_expiry." | mail -s "SSL Certificate Expiry Alert" user@example.com
fi

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

threshold=10

while true; do
    sar -n EDEV 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n SOCK 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n COLL 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    netstat -s | grep 'retransmited' | awk '$1 > "$threshold" {print $1}'
    sleep 60

done

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

largest_palindrome() {
    largest=0
    for ((i=100; i<1000; i++)); do
        for ((j=100; j<1000; j++)); do
            product=$((i * j))
            if [ $product -eq $(echo $product | rev) ] && [ $product -gt $largest ]; then
                largest=$product
            fi
        done
    done
    echo "$largest"
}
largest_palindrome
nl_command: Create a script to find the largest palindrome made from the product of two 3-digit numbers.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

certificate_expiry=$(openssl x509 -enddate -noout -in /path/to/certificate.pem | cut -d '=' -f 2)
current_date=$(date +%s)
expiry_date=$(date -d "$certificate_expiry" +%s)
expiry_days=$(( ($expiry_date - $current_date) / (60*60*24) ))
if [ "$expiry_days" -lt 30 ]; then
    echo "SSL certificate is about to expire in $expiry_days days."
    # Send alert here
fi
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system SSL certificate expiry and send an alert if any certificates are about to expire.

threshold="100"

#!/bin/bash

expiry=$(openssl x509 -enddate -noout -in /path/to/certificate.crt | cut -d= -f2)
expiry_date=$(date -d "$expiry" +%s)
current_date=$(date +%s)
days_left=$(( ($expiry_date - $current_date) / 86400 ))

if (( days_left < 30 )); then
    echo "SSL certificate expires in $days_left days" | mail -s "SSL Certificate Expiry Alert" admin@example.com
fi
nl_command: Create a script to monitor SSL certificate expiration dates and send alerts if certificates are nearing expiration.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

sum_of_digits() {
    num="$1"
    sum=0
    while [ "$num" -gt 0 ]; do
        digit=$((num % 10))
        sum=$((sum + digit))
        num=$((num / 10))
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_of_digits 12345
nl_command: Create a script to find the sum of all digits of a number.

#!/bin/bash

threshold=10

while true; do
    sar -n EDEV 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n SOCK 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sar -n COLL 1 1 | grep -w '.*[0-9]' | awk '$NF > "$threshold" {print $1, $NF}'
    sleep 60

done

#!/bin/bash

website="www.example.com"
expiry_date=$(echo | openssl s_client -servername "$website" -connect "$website":443 2>/dev/null | openssl x509 -noout -dates | grep "notAfter" | cut -d= -f2)
current_date=$(date --date="$(date)" +"%s")
expiry_date=$(date --date="$expiry_date" +"%s")
diff=$((expiry_date-current_date))
days=$((diff/(60*60*24)))
echo "$website SSL certificate expires in $days days."

#!/bin/bash

certificates="/etc/ssl/certs/*.crt"

for cert in $certificates; do
    expiration_date=$(openssl x509 -enddate -noout -in $cert | cut -d '=' -f 2)
    if [ $(date -d "$expiration_date" +%s) -lt $(date -d "now + 30 days" +%s) ]; then
        echo "SSL certificate $cert is about to expire on $expiration_date" | mail -s "SSL Certificate Expiry Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done

#!/bin/bash

service_name="<service_name>"
replicas=$(docker service inspect --format '{{.Spec.Mode.Replicated.Replicas}}' $service_name)
cpu_usage=$(docker service ps --format '{{.CurrentCPU}}' $service_name | awk '{sum+=$1} END {print sum}')
memory_usage=$(docker service ps --format '{{.CurrentMemory}}' $service_name | awk '{sum+=$1} END {print sum}')
if [ "$cpu_usage" -gt "100" ] || [ "$memory_usage" -gt "100" ]; then
    docker service scale $service_name=$((replicas+1))
fi
if [ "$cpu_usage" -lt "50" ] && [ "$memory_usage" -lt "50" ]; then
    docker service scale $service_name=$((replicas-1))
fi
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system Docker Swarm service status and scale services up or down based on resource utilization.

#!/bin/bash

threshold="500"

current_hour=$(date +'%H')

if [ "$current_hour" -ge "8" ] && [ "$current_hour" -le "18" ]; then
    processes=$(ps aux --sort=-%mem | awk 'NR<=5{print $11}')

    while read -r process; do
        mem_usage=$(ps -C "$process" --no-headers -o %mem | awk '{print $1}')
        if [ "$mem_usage" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
            echo "Process $process is consuming high memory during business hours: $mem_usage KB (root user)" | mail -s "Root High Memory Process during Business Hours Alert" user@example.com
        fi
    done <<< "$processes"
fi
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system root user process memory usage and send an alert if any process exceeds a certain memory usage during specific hours.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

sum_even_fibonacci() {
    limit="$1"
    a=0
    b=1
    sum=0
    while [ "$b" -lt "$limit" ]; do
        if [ $((b % 2)) -eq 0 ]; then
            sum=$((sum + b))
        fi
        next=$((a + b))
        a="$b"
        b="$next"
    done
    echo "$sum"
}
sum_even_fibonacci 4000000
nl_command: Create a script to find the sum of all even Fibonacci numbers less than a given limit.

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

largest_prime_factor() {
    num="$1"
    factor=2
    while [ "$factor" -le "$num" ]; do
        if [ $((num % factor)) -eq 0 ]; then
            num=$((num / factor))
        else
            factor=$((factor + 1))
        fi
    done
    echo "$factor"
}
largest_prime_factor 600851475143
nl_command: Create a script to find the largest prime factor of a given number.

threshold="3"
failed_attempts=$(grep 'authentication failure' /var/log/auth.log | awk '{print $11}' | sort | uniq -c | sort -nr | head -n 1 | awk '{print $1}')

if [ "$failed_attempts" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
    ip_address=$(grep 'authentication failure' /var/log/auth.log | awk '{print $11}' | sort | uniq -c | sort -nr | head -n 1 | awk '{print $2}')
    iptables -A INPUT -s $ip_address -j DROP
fi

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

strong_number() {
    num="$1"
    temp="$num"
    sum=0
    while [ "$num" -gt 0 ]; do
        digit=$((num % 10))
        factorial=1
        for ((i=1; i<=digit; i++)); do
            factorial=$((factorial * i))
        done
        sum=$((sum + factorial))
        num=$((num / 10))
    done
    if [ "$sum" -eq "$temp" ]; then
        echo "$temp is a strong number"
    else
        echo "$temp is not a strong number"
    fi
}
strong_number 145
nl_command: Create a script to check if a number is a strong number or not.

#!/bin/bash

is_prime() {
    num="$1"
    if [ "$num" -le 1 ]; then
        echo "$num is not a prime number"
        return
    fi
    for ((i=2; i<=num/2; i++)); do
        if [ $((num % i)) -eq 0 ]; then
            echo "$num is not a prime number"
            return
        fi
    done
    echo "$num is a prime number"
}
is_prime 17

#!/bin/bash

limit=50
sum=0
echo "Prime numbers up to $limit:" 
for ((num=2; num<=limit; num++)); do
    is_prime=true
    for ((i=2; i<=num/2; i++)); do
        if [ $((num % i)) -eq 0 ]; then
            is_prime=false
            break
        fi
    done
    if [ "$is_prime" = true ]; then
        sum=$((sum + num))
    fi
done
echo "The sum of prime numbers up to $limit is: $sum"

#!/bin/bash

count_occurrences() {
    arr=(1 2 2 3 3 4 5 5)
    declare -A occurrences
    for num in "${arr[@]}"; do
        occurrences[$num]=$((occurrences[$num] + 1))
    done
    for key in "${!occurrences[@]}"; do
        echo "$key: ${occurrences[$key]}"
    done
}

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

is_palindrome() {
    num="$1"
    reverse=0
    original="$num"
    while [ "$num" -gt 0 ]; do
        remainder=$((num % 10))
        reverse=$((reverse * 10 + remainder))
        num=$((num / 10))
    done
    if [ "$original" -eq "$reverse" ]; then
        echo "$original is a palindrome"
    else
        echo "$original is not a palindrome"
    fi
}
is_palindrome 121
nl_command: Create a script to check if a number is a palindrome or not.

#!/bin/bash

fibonacci() {
    n="$1"
    a=0
    b=1
    for ((i=2; i<=n; i++)); do
        next=$((a + b))
        a="$b"
        b="$next"
    done
    echo "$b"
}

#!/bin/bash

product_of_digits() {
    num="$1"
    product=1
    while [ "$num" -gt 0 ]; do
        digit=$((num % 10))
        product=$((product * digit))
        num=$((num / 10))
    done
    echo "$product"
}

#!/bin/bash

n=10
a=0
b=1
echo "Fibonacci Series up to $n terms:"
for ((i=0; i<n; i++)); do
    echo -n "$a "

#!/bin/bash

threshold="5000"

processes="$(ps -eo pid,%mem,command | grep -vE 'PID|%MEM' | sort -nr -k2 | head -n 5)"

while read -r line; do
    pid=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $1}')
    mem=$(echo "$line" | awk '{print $2}')

    if [ "$mem" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Process $pid is consuming high memory: $mem MB" | mail -s "High Memory Process Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$processes"

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

largest_prime_factor() {
    num="$1"
    largest=2
    while [ "$num" -gt 1 ]; do
        while [ $(($num % $largest)) -eq 0 ]; do
            num=$(($num / $largest))
        done
        largest=$(($largest + 1))
    done
    echo "$(( $largest - 1 ))"
}
largest_prime_factor 13195
nl_command: Create a script to find the largest prime factor of a given number.

threshold="5"

time_drift=$(ntpdate -q time.nist.gov | grep -o 'offset.*' | awk '{print $2}')

if [ "$time_drift_abs" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
    echo "System time drift is high: $time_drift seconds" | mail -s "Time Drift Alert" user@example.com
fi

directory="/path/to/directory"

bash_code:
#!/bin/bash

deployment_name="<deployment_name>"
replicas=$(kubectl get deployment $deployment_name -o=jsonpath='{.spec.replicas}')
cpu_requests=$(kubectl top pod -l app=$deployment_name --no-headers | awk '{print $2}' | awk '{sum+=$1} END {print sum}')
memory_requests=$(kubectl top pod -l app=$deployment_name --no-headers | awk '{print $3}' | awk '{sum+=$1} END {print sum}')
if [ "$cpu_requests" -gt "500m" ] || [ "$memory_requests" -gt "500Mi" ]; then
    kubectl scale deployment $deployment_name --replicas=$((replicas+1))
fi
if [ "$cpu_requests" -lt "250m" ] && [ "$memory_requests" -lt "250Mi" ]; then
    kubectl scale deployment $deployment_name --replicas=$((replicas-1))
fi
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system Kubernetes deployment status and scale deployments based on CPU and memory usage.

#!/bin/bash

certificates="/etc/ssl/certs/*.crt"

for cert in $certificates; do
    expiration_date=$(openssl x509 -enddate -noout -in $cert | cut -d '=' -f 2)
    if [ $(date -d "$expiration_date" +%s) -lt $(date -d "now + 30 days" +%s) ]; then
        echo "SSL certificate $cert is about to expire on $expiration_date" | mail -s "SSL Certificate Expiry Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system SSL certificate expiration dates and send an alert if any certificates are about to expire.

#!/bin/bash

threshold="500"

processes=$(ps aux --sort=-%mem | awk 'NR<=5{print $11}')

while read -r process; do
    mem_usage=$(ps -C "$process" --no-headers -o %mem | awk '{print $1}')
    if [ "$mem_usage" -gt "$threshold" ]; then
        echo "Process $process is consuming high memory: $mem_usage KB" | mail -s "High Memory Process Alert" user@example.com
    fi

done <<< "$processes"
nl_command: Create a script to monitor system process memory usage and send an alert if any process exceeds a certain memory usage.
Create a script to monitor system file permissions and send alerts if any files are world-writable.
Save the list of all subdirectories of the current directory as "dirs_to_remove"
List *.txt files under current directory that have 'mystring' in their name
